div1.p: The Surgeon General's office sends a photograph of Reed to Purcell and refers him to Kelly's book. [Courtesy of the National Archives and Records Administration]

div1.head: Surgeon General's Office Record Card, June 2, 1909
div1.p:
M.A. Purcell
Williamsburg Va May 26, 1909
Requests photograph of Dr
Walter Reed, and also any
publications giving an account
of Dr Reed and his associates.

Actg Surgeon General, PH and
M.H.S. May 29, 1909 refers.
to S. G. of the army. File S.

6 June 3,1909. Mr. M. A. Purcell, Col-
lege of William and Mary, Williams-
burg, Va. Sir: I am instructed by the
Actg. Surgeon General to acknowledge
receipt by reference from the Sur-
geon General Public Health & Marine
Hospital Service, of your letter of
the 26th ultimo, and in reply to state
that a full history of the life and
service of Dr. Walter Reed may be
found in “Walter Reed and Yellow Fev-
er” by Howard A. Kelly, Published by
McClure, Phillips and Company, N. Y. City
1906. A copy of a photograph of the
late Dr. Walter Reed has this day been
mailed to your address under separate
cover.

C.L., Maj., Med. Corps, U. S. A.
B.M.I.

memo
check for $300, in part
payment for portrait
of the late Major Wal-
ter Reed, U. S. A. forwarded
to Mrs H. G. Duncan,
Warrenton, Va.
Refer 107126 8 B
